channel.title: Running a server/client on Mac osX or Linux!
channel.description:
Dont spose this could be stickied or soemthign as i have seen alot of threads about this.
The only reason people on mac and linux have trouble is because they do not use .bat files. They use .sh files instead.
So here they are:
.sh scripts (apple macs and linux's .bat equivelent)
Compiling: [code]#!/bin/sh javac *.java[/code]
Running: [code]#!/bin/sh Java server [/code]
They could be saved and ran as shell scripts or ran from the terminal(<3 Yakuake terminal)

item.title: Running a server/client on Mac osX or Linux!
item.dc:creator: @h4x0r88 h4x0r88
item.description:
@h4x0r88 wrote:

Leel omfg i pst leek dis![br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 16, 2009, 09:06:42 pm[/size][hr]Hey thanks for the short tut can you make one
a bit longer or mabee please upload a source with the .sh(es) already on it?
But contact me via msn please? My email is:greenandredrocker@yahoo.com[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 17, 2009, 01:39:08 pm[/size][hr]thats linux only this is mac

[code]
cd ~/Desktop/(yoursourcename)

java -Xmx256m server[/code]
